description:
“Trulieve Grows One Patient at a Time”

If you have an interest in being part of one of the fastest growing industries in the nation in you may consider wanting to work for Trulieve! If you have a desire to help others in need through your efforts, this may be the role for you!

At Trulieve, we strive to bring our patients the relief they need in a product they can trust. Our plants are hand-grown in an environment specially designed to reduce unwanted chemicals and pests, keeping the process as natural as possible at every turn.

Our products are designed to alleviate seizures, severe and persistent muscle spasms, pain, nausea, loss of appetite, and other symptoms associated with serious medical conditions such as cancer.

Our specially trained staff works hand-in-hand with physicians to provide the right products and the correct dosage to ensure patients get the compassionate care they need.

Requisition ID: 9344

Remote Work Available: Yes

Director of Strategic Partnerships

Location: Florida

Reports to: Executive Director of Real Estate & State Expansion

Position Summary:

The Director of Strategic Partnerships will be responsible for developing and executing strategic initiatives to drive growth and expansion in medical & adult-use cannabis markets. This role will focus on establishing and nurturing partnerships with key stakeholders, including government agencies, healthcare providers, advocacy groups, and other industry players. The individual in this role will leverage their expertise in business development and regulatory affairs to identify new opportunities for market entry and drive operational efficiencies in new state expansion.

Key Responsibilities:
• Strategic Partnership Development:
• Identify and prioritize potential strategic partners, including government agencies, healthcare organizations, advocacy groups, and industry associations.
• Develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders to drive collaboration and achieve mutual goals.
• Negotiate partnership agreements and contracts to ensure alignment of objectives and compliance with regulatory requirements.
• Market Expansion Strategy:
• Supervise market research and analysis to identify opportunities for expansion into new states and regions.
• Work closely with cross-functional teams to execute market expansion initiatives and achieve business objectives.
• Business Development:
• Identify and pursue new business opportunities to drive revenue growth and market share expansion.
• Evaluate potential partnerships, and joint ventures to support strategic objectives.
• Lead the development of business proposals, presentations, and pitches to secure new partnerships and opportunities.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred.
• Minimum of 5 years of experience in strategic partnerships, business development, or related roles, preferably in the medical cannabis or pharmaceutical industry.
• Strong understanding of regulatory requirements and compliance considerations in the medical cannabis industry.
• Proven track record of developing and executing successful partnership strategies and driving business growth.
• Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
• Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
• Strategic thinker with a results-oriented mindset and a passion for innovation and growth.

Salary will be commensurate with experience. A comprehensive benefits package including paid time off is offered with this position. This position will work an average of 40 hours per week and will be available “after hours” if an emergency situation should arise.

Trulieve provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
